Reviews.Title: “great canalview room in the best place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Fermoura
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a canalview room and really loved it! The room wasspacious, with 03 (!) really big french windows overlooking the lovely and very romantic Leliegracht (a small canal street lit by amber lights at night). The bathroom was also good, breakfast inclued was quite neat and the staff was very caring and gentle. But most of all, the Grachtengordel (Canal ring) region turned out to be the best place to stay in Amsterdam if one wants to get the most of the cityÂ´s unique character and architecture. It is a very nice neighborhood, with lots of cafÃ©s, shops, restaurants, and small streets to hang around, but also a place where people live, go ice skating h in the canals during the winter, children play, and wherever you look around, you know you are in Amsterdam, surrounded by those lovely and typical canal houses. In spite of the very cold whether, we still managed to go almost everywhere in the city on foot. Beware only of the very sharp staircase, which is, by the way another common characteristic of the canal houses. Will definitely try to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: AILEEN Q
Reviews.Content: The three of us had a lovely stay at the hotel.It was in a brilliant location with lots of bars and good restaurants in the area. The staff were very friendly and helpfully, helping us carry our cases up the steep stairs. The room we stayed in was very spacious and unusual in design which added to the Amsterdam experience. The beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept in, in a hotel. Another positive was the quietness of the area and the hotel room, you would have thought you were the only guests. The breakfast was good and you could help yourself to a variety of foods and drinks on offer. Overall our stay from start to finish was stress free and we would certainly return to Amsterdam and stay in the 't' hotel. Well done to the management and staff you made us feel very welcome. Aileen, Ann and Michele- Glasgow-Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Steph_Fu
Reviews.Content: The building and rooms were dated but clean. The staff were great and friendly. Great place to stay for an Amsterdam experience. Located downtown of the "red light district", close to everything. Morning Continental breakfast was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for the real Amsterdam experience”
Reviews.Author: Jim P
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at 't hotel (pronounced ut 'otel) just about once a year for the last six years while on business and pleasure trips to Amsterdam. It's pretty easy to fly through AMS on Delta and find a way to spend a few days, plus there have been several conferences in Amsterdam the past few years that I have attended. The hotel is incredibly convenient and quite authentic. If you mind climbing stairs, don't look at this place. The staff will happily carry your luggage up and down, so that is not a consideration. Very clean and a wonderful family-run hotel. Tasty and plentiful breakfast. Close to the Jordaan where there are an unbelievable number of fantastic restaurants for every taste, as well as small bars and pubs. Not a bad walk from the Central Station, but close to a tram line. Take the money you save by staying here and have a wonderful meal in the Jordaan. Or two. You won't regret it! There is a pub just a few steps from the front door which is an authentic Brown Cafe, as well as a great restaurant and a hand-made pizza take-out where the locals line up. A block away is the Westerkerk and the Belgian fry stall, along with an Albert Heijn grocery. You can spend your whole vacation within walking distance of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever !”
Reviews.Author: Peter W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent six nights in room #4 in late November. This was our third stay in five trips to Amsterdam . We stayed in NH hotels on the other two trips....only because the 't Hotel was booked. We have only stayed in canal view rooms .. lots of room ....very very quiet and comfortable...great breakfast and a staff that really cares.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the stairs, loved the room.”
Reviews.Author: tisidor
Reviews.Content: The L'hotel is a nice small hotel that I found too be clean and the service friendly. Our room was on the top floor and was quite spacious with a lovely view of the canal. The only down side was the exceptionally narrow stairs, which are not unusual in Amsterdam. Not only were they narrow, there was probably 70 to 80 steps to reach the room. Wasn't aware when I booked and it's a good thing we both could handle the trek up. Can guarantee that many would have big problem traversing those stairs. So make sure you stay on lower floor unless you're ready for a workout. After you take the stairs into account, you'll really like the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location is superb!”
Reviews.Author: janebCanada
Reviews.Content: Loved staying in a canal house. Family run and very nice people. Located so close to all the attractions but just of the main area to be enjoyable. Great shopping and restaurants in the area. Yes there are stairs but they are so super to help you up and down with your luggage. The breakfast was plentiful and had great hours. Room was large and we enjoyed staying here very much. Very clean bathroom and room. Only downfall was the walls could of had a good washing but owners are trying so hard that I am sure when they read this review the walls will be washed. Do not hesitate to stay at this small family run hotel. So easy to find from the central station and located close to Anne Frank House.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Bolly27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal position for many of the sights in Amsterdam. We enjoyed being on a canal and having some eateries in the same street where we could sit on the banks of the canal and watch the watercraft pass by as we ate. It is very close to the Joordan area with many reataurants and bars. Our room was large and clean with a recently renovated bathroom. We were at the back of the hotel so there was no problem with noise. Yes, the stairs are very steep but this is the case in most hotels in this city and there is a stair lift if needed. Breakfast is served in the basement - it is not fancy but certainly adequate. All the staff we met were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: LinBoston
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately due to a reservation mix-up that was beyond the control of the hotel staff, I had lost my reservation and was in need of another hotel room when I arrived at 't Hotel. The staff could not have been nicer about the problem. The manager called a nearby hotel, arranged a room, and even drove me to the new hotel! I wish I could have stayed at 't Hotel for my night in Amsterdam, the hotel was lovely and staff beyond expectations in terms of hospitality. Next time I am in town, I will stay at 't Hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: CougNicco
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family visiting as part of our travels, we had 2 rooms side by side and they were both very nice. The staff is very helpful in all that they do, they will tell you about where to eat, are more than happy to assist you with museum recommendations. Breakfast is included in your stay and is in a separate part of the hotel. Only warning is that this hotel has very very steep stairs, so if you are unable to walk up stairs this is not the place for you. They do have a handicap lift though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: FruitbatNT
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at t' hotel in May 2011 with my partner. THE GOOD: Location - Close enough to the action (10-15 minute walk to the Royal Palace / Dam Square) but far enough out to be relatively quiet. Rooms - Nice rooms overall, somewhat small (even compared to our hotels in Bruges, Brussels and Boullion, and especially compared to North American Hotels), but clean and reasonably appointed. Our rear-view room had a nice view of a courtyard/garden of a few neighboring buildings. Bed was a queen size and quite comfortable. The bathroom (at least in our "garden view" room) looked recently updated, but had a shower setup that seemed to encourage spraying water all over the place (hand-shower, no shower-curtain). As a Canadian I'm not sure if this is standard, or odd for European accommodations, although I didn't see it again on our trip through Belgium. Breakfast - Good choice of fruits, breads, cheese, some meat, yogurt, cereals. No warm options (other than toast I suppose) but that's expected. Service - Very warm and helpful staff (owners?). Only "problem" I could see coming up (and it happened to a couple other visitors during our stay) is that they lock the "day door" at odd times, I guess when they need to leave the front desk, leaving you unable to access your room if you don't have a key for the night door (ex - run out for a minute and leave the key with someone in your room). WiFi - Quick, free wifi connection. THE BAD: Staircase - Not really a negative, but something you need to be aware of - stairs are VERY steep and narrow. They do however have a power-lift chair, but I have no idea of the speed/hassle of using it if you need to. The Safe : Kind of a silly thing for some people, but the complimentary "safe" in the room (a small digital-locking one with simple instructions) is only secured with 2 small screws to a particle-board shelf in the wardrobe. I'd recommend NOT using the safe, as it's an obvious target and would be very easy for any thief to remove from it's location and break open off-site. Most chain hotels secure their safes with large lag screw through concrete walls, or at least directly into wall studs. Power outlets : Another minor issue - only 1 "open" power outlet in our room, (or None if you have the fan plugged in) making it inconvenient to plug in laptop charger, etc where I'd like it. Glad I brought a small North American power bar instead of multiple converters.

Reviews.Title: “Great Canal House experience”
Reviews.Author: Neidin_Ban
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 't Hotel for 3 nights in mid-April. The location and neighbourhood are wonderful - typical Amsterdam. The steep stairs are a challenge but part of the experience of staying in a true Canal House. The room was clean but basic, in Ireland it would be more B+B style than 3 star. Duvet covers were past sell-by date - rather grey! Breakfast was plentiful and very good and the staff very friendly and helpful. Brilliant location for touring all aspects of Amsterdam especially by bicycle!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Temuskia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in April 2011. The hotel is in a great location....close to Westerkerk, Dam Square and Jordaan but in a quiet neighborhood that's a respite from the hustle and bustle. Our room was on the first floor overlooking a small courtyard. We had no problems with noise. The room was spacious and the bed was comfortable. We only had a shower (no bathtub) but the bathroom was spotless. The free Wi-fi was very much appreciated. Breakfast (in the basement accessed from outside) was more than adequate....breads, cheeses, lunchmeats, cereals, hard-boiled eggs, fruits and yogurts. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only downside to the hotel is the steep stairways. Although there is a stairlift to the first level of rooms, the stairway leading to the breakfast room might be challenging for anyone with mobility issues. Even so, I would definitely stay in this hotel again and would recommend it to all of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Gracious and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: amycandrews
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 't Hotel for four nights with our two young children. The hotel was extremely well located and made it easy to get around Amsterdam. The room was up two steep flights of stairs, which was a surprise, but it worked out just fine. The property was very clean and suited our needs well. The highlight for us was the staff. They went above and beyond to help us - from when we needed to take our daughter to the doctor to helping us celebrate our son's birthday. Our room overlooked the canal and was a bit loud at night, but we were still really pleased with our choice. Overall, we had a really nice stay. It was a perfect "homebase" for our Amsterdam adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Great three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: theluxuriant
Reviews.Content: wonderful three star hotel in Amsterdam. They gave us a room we had not chosen bur this has to be the best you can get for three stars. Very clean, beware of steep stairs if you get room 7 or 8.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nick_sandberg
Reviews.Content: Beautifully located beside the Lelie canal. Small but nice clean hotel with friendly service. Breakfast nothing to write home about but all in all a lovely place in a really beautiful part of Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “decent place; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: fluidtherapy
Reviews.Content: stayed for several days in January; everything was sufficient for our needs and wants. facility is decent but nothing particularly special or unique. great neighborhood and location in Amsterdam, in general. decent rooms; nice bathrooms (gotta love the towel warmers in winter); very good staff although I was less than impressed with our room service (maid service) on several days; breakfast good and plentiful. the hotel was perfect for our intended purpose: to galavant about Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: janoleolsen
Reviews.Content: Service friendly staff. Several centuries old canal house with steep stairs, but handicap lift if you don't dare walk the stairs. Good standard of bathroom, room included safe and mini fridge. Amsterdam in my view is more expensive than London, considering this - the price of the hotel was reasonable for what you get. The city is not very car friendly, only free/cheap parking is outside the city. Getting a local bike is useful. Hotel is ca 1km away from the centre, like Dam square and railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel with great service and location”
Reviews.Author: JourneyLady47
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with the hotel. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The staff was helpful with everything from luggage to directions. We appreciated the easy walking distance to many attractions in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “The serene, upscale residential location of this nice place is perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Kamellbos
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant, clean, quiet, comfortable and well-kept place in a location that is just about perfect. You can walk to almost anywhere you'd want to go in the city - from the nine streets to the museum area and beyond. The Anne Frank house is just around the corner. The staff are friendly and accommodating, and will help get luggage up and down the admittedly very steep stairs. The room we had (Prinsengracht) was quite spacious and overlooked the canal, which was a treat, and the bathroom is to a high standard. The breakfast is typical continental, and more than adequate. I would look forward to staying here again should I ever make it back to the lovely city of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel on one of the best spots in town”
Reviews.Author: KettyJones
Reviews.Content: We stayed a long weekend in 't Hotel, situated on the lovely Leliegracht. We stayed before in Amsterdam, and noticed 't Hotel after our visit to Anne Frank house, walking along this nice canal. When we arrived, the staff was so helpfull, not only they moved our luggage upstairs, but also they had a list with recommended restaurants (with a map of the town to show where the restaurant is located), and also helped us a lot with planning our trips in and around Amsterdam. Our room overlooked the canal and was big! There was free wireless internet in the room, I hate to pay for this (sometimes you have to pay EUR 10,00...)! Very good, 't Hotel! We would certainly return in 't Hotel, there is enough to explore in Amsterdam for a next visit. 't Hotel Amsterdam: highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Not good.”
Reviews.Author: 5travelpros
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disappointment. There was never anyone at the front desk when we needed assistance. The room was tired and old. The bathroom was minute. There was nothing chic or hip about the place. The top room did hold our family of 5 but we checked out after 1 night and found a room elsewhere of equal size.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: MaryV85
Reviews.Content: We loved our 2 night stay at the 't Hotel in the Jordaan neighborhood of Amsterdam. The location is absolutely perfect. The front desk staff was very helpful and accommodating during our visit. Our family of 4 stayed in the large guest room with a loft on the 3rd floor of this canal house/hotel. Breakfast was delicious! There are plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby. And we rented bicycles just a few blocks away from the hotel. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great location and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: inspector_tom
Reviews.Content: I stumbled across this place on the internet because we wanted a Jordaan location. What a lucky break because the location is perfect and the hotel quaint, clean and reasonable prices. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful with recommendations for dining. We will definitely return on our next trip to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, excellent staff and location”
Reviews.Author: mizwiz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with friends after a Rhine River cruise. The hotel is cute, a typical old canal house conversion but more well-done than many others. The baths were generously sized as were the rooms. We had the top floor canal view room (the Leliegracht) which is an attic space. Our friends had the more elegant Prinsengracht; both had their own character and the views were lovely. The photos on the hotel's website are pretty accurate. The staff was very friendly and helpful. One of our suitcases was caught up in the Icelandic ash problem and we had some emails back and forth trying to have it delivered to the hotel before our arrival. The staff was very responsive to our emails and request. Breakfast was in a basement space and was adequate, not expansive but sufficient to start the day. The location is very convenient to good restaurants and a take-out pizza place that was always jammed. We would definitely consider staying here again if we return to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located B&B”
Reviews.Author: Chach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned to meet up with a few friends in Amsterdam for about 5 days. We had been to the city several times and knew not to stay in the overly touristy areas. The t'hotel is conveniently located to everything: transit, restaurants, bars, shopping, etc... We ended up getting one of the rooms towards the back, while our friends got the canal rooms. I ended up being very jealous since the canal rooms were large and had great views. We didn't spend much time in our room so it didn't really matter. The breakfast was served downstairs and very tasty. The owner was very friendly and helpful during our stay. The only drawback was the slow/spotty internet and crappy cable. But otherwise, everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Grate location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: aditrip
Reviews.Content: Thanks for a grate weekend! My husband and I spent the weekend at t'hotel, the location is grate, close to everything yet a quite street. Very nice staff- their flexibility with check in and check out times was amazing and very important for us. Nice rooms with large windows, nice bath. Good breakfast included in very reasonable price. And as a bonus a grate pizzeria next door

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: TS44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend and had exchanged emails with the staff who provided details of transport and a map etc to the hotel. Despite arriving very early (10am in the morning), our room was ready and we probably had the best room in the hotel; room Number 1 on the first floor overlooking the canal. Whilst this meant it was a little noisy on the Friday night with people leaving pubs etc, the view was lovely and it also meant that there weren't too many stairs to walk up. The room was clean, warm, well presented and bigger than we expected with a bath/shower, king size bed, two chairs, a large plasma screen tv, tea/coffee, biscuits, corkscrew and fridge (not stocked). The staff were helpful and the guy on reception helped us to our room and carried our bags. As well as all of this, one of the best things was the location. It was right around the corner from the Anne Frank House and close by to some fantastic restaurants (we'd certainly recommend Envy and Christophe - not cheap but very good food and wine). The only down-side was the fact that the 'consumables' in our room were not topped-up (ie coffee, bath gel, toilet roll) and despite the fridge, there was no milk to have with the tea and coffee (although I'm sure if we asked, they would have provided some).

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved!!!”
Reviews.Author: slairson
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to ANYONE visiting Amsterdam. I am a planner by trade, so of course, I did A LOT of research for this trip - our first to Europe. I did even more research when it came to the hotel. I wanted something authentic (i.e. no chain hotel). We had a fairly decent budget and I was determined to stay in something nice. Cleanliness was very important, as was the bathroom. We could not have been happier with this property. Not only is it in the Jordaan District, it is also on one of the nicest canals in the city. Location, location, location. I had no idea how important that would be on our trip - but this hotel was in the PERFECT location. I contacted the hotel directly via e-mail. They responded quickly and made the reservation. I had told them that we would be celebrating our 15th anniversary while we were there and also requested a canal view room. I confirmed via e-mail a couple of days prior to our arrival with the time of our flight, etc. We were greeted at the door upon our arrival to the hotel. Check in was a breeze, as they had been waiting for us. We were quite early, so the room was not yet clean, but we were able to freshen up and then get into the city while they held our bags. We came back a couple of hours later and they escorted us up to our room. We were on the third floor (room #7 Leliegracht) - a killer on the legs with those canal house stairs, but worth it. In fact, when we got into the room, there were a few vases with flowers and a bottle of prosecco to celebrate our anniversary. I think the room was fully equipped. Room safe, desk, TV, mini-fridge, good bathroom. The hotel has central heat so you cannot control the temperature, but it was perfect the entire time. The hotel is also a few blocks away from Westerkerk (West Church) which had beautiful bells tolling every 15 minutes. Waking up each morning to church bells was amazing. I cannot say enough great things about this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just back...loved it!”
Reviews.Author: aahowell
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be unusually helpful, kind and charming! The rooms were big, and bathroom modern and welcoming! We found the location ideal for all kinds of exploring, not to mention, around the corner from the Anne Frank house. Ideal accommodations!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the 't hotel”
Reviews.Author: RileyDogma
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 days at 't Hotel and it was fabulous. 't Hotel is a boutique hotel right on a canal in the heart of the city. It is very quiet, kid friendly, super clean. Very close to the Anne Frank house, great restaurants and shopping. There is not a bar or lounge. We reserved the canal view room and got room 7, top floor. When we got to the room (at 11pm) the crib was set up and there was a baby bath tub waiting for us. At breakfast, which is included, the super attentive owners had already set up a high chair for us. Breakfast consisted of meats, cheese, hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, fruit, breads and granola. Very standard and delicious. The very knowledgeable staff was able to recommend restaurants, call cabs, and guide us in several ways with their fluent English. the ONLY drawback is there is one at all, is that the stairs are very narrow, steep and the ceilings in our room were sloped on one side which made it somewhat challenging for my 6'1" husband.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 444Trvlrs
Reviews.Content: t Hotel is in a great location, on a pretty canal in the Western Canal belt near the Jordaan. Its a fantastic location to explore Amsterdam without being in the midst of the touristy areas which tend to get a little cheesy. The staff is fantastic - they answered all our questions and even let us use their computer when we needed internet. We stayed in a room with a garden view (non-canal) and it was charming, bright and quiet. Note, the hotel has quite a few steep stairs to get to the rooms so those with trouble on stairs be wary. Overall, we were extremely happy and had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice people”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorLen
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4-night stay in Room 4 on the top floor, and encountered a grand total of one mosquito in our room. No problems with that at all. The rooms could use some spiffing up, but ours was quite comfortable and certainly not ugly or tacky in any way. The location can't be beat, and the people running it were as nice and helpful as could be. Not a luxury property, but a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay but bitten alive by Mozzies in OCTOBER!!”
Reviews.Author: josiec
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this quaint little hotel. It is situated on a lovely little canal with gorgeous canal houses just 10 mins walk from Anne Frank house, which when you see the queues, proves to be very useful. You can get up early and get there for 9am when it opens. 'T Hotel is fairly well located for most places really as you can hop on a tram or canal bus or even walk. I was slightly disappointed in the hotel -I thought it would be more elegant. It was more a shop with rooms!!! The reception is the shop counter and there is no real "hotel" identity. Don't get me wrong the people were lovely and there is a really nice breakfast room which you get to by going just out of the hotel and down the stairs into the basement. Good breakfast and they even provided a packed breakfast for us on the early morning start to the airport. The rooms are adequate and clean but getting on the tired side -few stains on carpet, rusty tiles, chipped paintwork , dusty stairwell etc but still have a homely feel and done out in neutral tones. Our party had 2 rooms at the back overlooking the garden. The beds were VERY comfy and we would have had a good sleep..........BUT the MOSQUITOS were horrendous and it was the end of October so not just a summer problem. I just didn't sleep. They LOVE me and I have come home with about 5 bites on my face which have all swollen up and various on my body. I know that is not the management's fault and they do provide one of those electrical "zapper" thingys which does the job but that is what you pay for staying so near the canals I think. I would recommend this hotel for a few days but not a longer stay but take lots of Deet!! There are quite a few brown cafe's around which do good food in the evening very Dutch wholesome stuff and have great atmosphere. There is one just along from 't Hotel but the restaurant with the Michelin star mentioned on the hotel website is very expensive as you would imagine and looked a bit "stiff". Don't miss "The Night watch" by Rembrandt at the Rijksmuseum or the Anne Frank house which is so moving. The Van Gogh museum is also interesting.

HotelInfo.Name: 't Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Leliegracht 18, Amsterdam 1015 DE, The Netherlands
